sentences.sContent: a fire in a remote mountain area
...which allows viewers to use their remote controls to click on advertisements...
...When we ask teens to choose a hero，they usually select an older family member rather than a remote public figure...
...would soon be able to purchase a sweater like Jennifer Aniston's with a few taps on their remote control...
...Cablevision hopes to allow customers to buy things with their remote controls early next year...
...the study of Chinese has become a remote memory...
...The UK network of Business Links confirms that it too has seen a growing interest in remote working solutions from small businesses seeking its advice...
...is an interesting tool to any business supporting remote working...
...and claims that as many as 60-70% of the businesses that come through its doors now offer some form of remote working support to their workforces...
...decided to introduce support for remote working at the same time...

words.tran: 遥远；偏僻；细微；时间久远

trans.tranCn: 遥远的， 偏僻的； 关系疏远的； 脱离的； 绝少的； 微乎其微的； 孤高的， 冷淡的
trans.tranOther: far from towns or other places where people live
